Horizontal Waterfall Plot

g_waterfall.Rd

This basic waterfall plot visualizes a quantity height ordered by value with some markup.

g_waterfall(
  height,
  id,
  col = NULL,
  xlab = NULL,
  ylab = NULL,
  col_legend_title = NULL,
  title = NULL
)

Arguments

height

(numeric vector)
Contains values to be plotted as the waterfall bars
id

(vector)
Contains of IDs used as the x-axis label for the waterfall bars
col

(vector)
Categorical variable for bar coloring
xlab

(character value)
x label. Default is ID.
ylab

(character value)
y label. Default is Value.
col_legend_title

(character value)
Text to be displayed as legend title.
title

(character value)
Text to be displayed as plot title.

Examples

g_waterfall(height = c(3,5,-1), id = letters[1:3])

g_waterfall(
  height = c(3,5,-1),
  id = letters[1:3],
  col = letters[1:3]
)
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.

library(random.cdisc.data)
library(dplyr)

ADSL <- radsl(cached = TRUE)
ADSL_f <- ADSL %>%
  select(USUBJID, STUDYID, ARM, ARMCD, SEX)

ADRS <- radrs(cached = TRUE)
ADRS_f <- ADRS %>%
  filter(PARAMCD == "OVRINV") %>%
  mutate(pchg = rnorm(n(), 10, 50))

ADRS_f <- head(ADRS_f, 30)
ADRS_f <- ADRS_f[!duplicated(ADRS_f$USUBJID),]
head(ADRS_f)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 44
#>   STUDYID USUBJID SUBJID SITEID   AGE SEX   RACE  COUNTRY INVID INVNAM ARM  
#>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr>  <int> <fct> <fct> <fct>   <chr> <chr>  <fct>
#> 1 AB12345 AB1234… id-105 BRA-1     38 M     BLAC… BRA     INV … Dr. B… A: D…
#> 2 AB12345 AB1234… id-134 BRA-1     47 M     WHITE BRA     INV … Dr. B… A: D…
#> 3 AB12345 AB1234… id-141 BRA-1     35 F     WHITE BRA     INV … Dr. B… C: C…
#> 4 AB12345 AB1234… id-236 BRA-1     32 M     BLAC… BRA     INV … Dr. B… B: P…
#> 5 AB12345 AB1234… id-265 BRA-1     25 M     WHITE BRA     INV … Dr. B… C: C…
#> # … with 33 more variables: ARMCD <fct>, ACTARM <fct>, ACTARMCD <fct>,
#> #   REGION1 <fct>, STRATA1 <fct>, STRATA2 <fct>, BMRKR1 <dbl>, BMRKR2 <fct>,
#> #   ITTFL <fct>, SAFFL <fct>, BMEASIFL <fct>, BEP01FL <fct>, RANDDT <date>,
#> #   TRTSDTM <dttm>, TRTEDTM <dttm>, EOSSTT <fct>, EOSDT <date>, EOSDY <int>,
#> #   DCSREAS <fct>, DTHDT <date>, LSTALVDT <date>, study_duration_secs <dbl>,
#> #   ASEQ <int>, RSSEQ <int>, PARAM <fct>, PARAMCD <fct>, AVAL <int>,
#> #   AVALC <fct>, ADTM <dttm>, ADY <int>, AVISIT <fct>, AVISITN <int>,
#> #   pchg <dbl>

g_waterfall(
  height = ADRS_f$pchg,
  id = ADRS_f$USUBJID,
  col = ADRS_f$AVALC
)
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.

g_waterfall(
  height = ADRS_f$pchg,
  id = ADRS_f$USUBJID,
  col = ADRS_f$AVALC
)
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.

g_waterfall(
  height = ADRS_f$pchg,
  id = paste("asdfdsfdsfsd",ADRS_f$USUBJID),
  col = ADRS_f$SEX
)
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.
#> Warning: Use of `plot_data_ord$col` is discouraged. Use `col` instead.

g_waterfall(
  height = ADRS_f$pchg,
  id = paste("asdfdsfdsfsd",ADRS_f$USUBJID),
  xlab = "ID",
  ylab = "Percentage Change",
  title = "Waterfall plot"
)
